content.body: I'm looking into the Array.fromAsync proposal and have a question about what people's understanding of "Zalgo" is (to explain the [jargon](https://blog.izs.me/2013/08/designing-apis-for-asynchrony/), Zalgo is a reference to a meme, that is used as shorthand for the situation where an async operation sometimes calls a callback and sometimes doesn't)

I'm looking into the Array.fromAsync proposal and have a question about what people's understanding of "Zalgo" is (to explain the jargon, Zalgo is a reference to a meme, that is used as shorthand for the situation where an async operation sometimes calls a callback and sometimes doesn't)

content.body: is throwing an error immediately, on bad input, Zalgo?
